meanings.sent1: The squirrel was bound by the fence and couldn't escape.

meanings.definition: Heading or moving in a specified direction
meanings.sent1: The train was bound for the city, carrying many passengers.
meanings.sent2: The airplane was bound to land at the scheduled time.
meanings.sent3: The determined athlete was bound to reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed boundlessly towards the sea.
meanings.sent5: The migrating birds were bound to their winter destination.

meanings.definition: Obliged by moral or legal duty
meanings.sent1: She felt bound to help her friend in need.
meanings.sent2: The doctor was bound by the oath of confidentiality.
meanings.sent3: The knight felt bound to protect the kingdom from all threats.
meanings.sent4: The superhero was bound by a sense of justice to fight crime.
meanings.sent5: The loyal dog felt bound to stay by its owner's side.

meanings.definition: Ready or prepared to do something

meanings.sent2: She was bound to ace the test after studying all night.
meanings.sent3: The chef was bound to impress the guests with his culinary creations.
meanings.sent4: The explorer was bound to discover new lands on his expedition.
meanings.sent5: The student was bound to excel in his academic pursuits.
